text.p: The Anglo-U.S. telecoms partners planning to form giant merger company Concert Plc on Sunday detailed the combination of increased marketing revenue and cost savings that they predict will bring annual benefits of about 500 million stg in the fifth year following merger.

British Telecom and MCI told a joint news conference in London their preliminary evaluation showed that by year five global marketing activities would contribute 160 million stg more to revenue. In addition, their respective business areas BT Syntegra and SHL would be able contribute to new savings in administrative and procurement costs totalling 180 million stg.

The third large element of improvement, freeing 160 million stg equivalent per year, would come from a reduced need for capital spending on networks thanks to capacity savings and improved purchasing power when the two groups' networks combine.
According to the firms, MCI already carries about 40 percent of worldwide traffic on the Internet.
